cling.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to hold someone or something tightly, especially because you do not feel safe
cling.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: He wailed and clung to his mother.
Passengers clung desperately on to the lifeboats.
cling.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: to stick to someone or something, or seem to surround them
cling.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: His wet shirt clung to his body.
The smell of cigarette smoke clung to her clothes.
cling.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: to stay close to someone all the time because you are too dependent on them or do not feel safe â€“ used to show disapproval
cling.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: Some children tend to cling on their first day at school.
